feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 4:44PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: Low pressure has moved into the Gulf of Alaska, bringing widespread moderate to heavy rain along with strong winds. Around a half an inch of rain has been measured in some areas over the last 12 hours and occasional gusts to 40 mph have been observed along the outer coast so far. Confidence remains high on widespread total rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches across the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 2:54PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Expected Wednesday Through Friday... Elevated surf is expected along the Chukchi Sea coast, including Kotzebue Sound and north-facing coasts of the Seward Peninsula. North to northwesterly winds will increase on Wednesday to 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for coastal areas of the Chukchi Sea. Winds will gradually
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Lower Kobuk Valley; Noatak Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula; Shishmaref

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 2:53PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Expected Wednesday Night Through Friday... Elevated surf is expected along the western Arctic coast from near Point Hope to Wainwright. North to northwesterly winds will increase on Wednesday to 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for coastal areas. Winds will gradually decrease Friday. Wave action may cause minor
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northwest Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 2:53PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Blowing Snow This Afternoon and Tonight... Strong west winds are expected to increase to 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph. The combination of gusty winds and periods of snow will lead to areas of blowing snow through tonight. Visibility may be reduced to less than a mile at times this evening and tonight. Conditions are expected to improve Wednesday
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 10:09AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RESUSPENDED ASH FROM KATMAI-NOVARUPTA EXPECTED OVER KODIAK ISLAND TONIGHT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... Strong northwesterly winds (up to 40 mph) will develop this afternoon and persist through late Wednesday night. There is a high chance (75-85%) that these winds will resuspend ash from the 1912 Katmai- Novarupta eruption. The villages of Karluk, Akhiok
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kodiak Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 6:37PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...GUSTY NORTHWEST WINDS EXPECTED THIS EVENING... A strong frontal boundary will move east across central South Dakota this evening. This will bring a brief period of strong and gusty winds from 40 mph to perhaps 55 mph. Those outdoors, or those traveling with high profile vehicles should be prepared for sudden gusty winds as this front passes through.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Campbell; Corson; Dewey; Hughes; Jones; Lyman; Potter; Stanley; Sully; Walworth
